section.para: This extensions allows to set some device specific channel settings for AnyTone devices. There are some general settings, valid for FM and DMR channels as well some FM and DMR specific settings.

example.title: Examples of the AnyTone extensions for FM and DMR channels.
example.programlisting: channels: - dmr: name: Example DMR channel # ... anytone: talkaround: false frequencyCorrection: 0 handsFree: false callConfirm: false sms: true smsConfirm: false dataACK: true simplexTDMA: false adaptiveTDMA: false loneWorker: false throughMode: false - fm: name: Example FM channel # ... anytone: talkaround: false frequencyCorrection: 0 handsFree: false reverseBurst: false rxCustomCTCSS: false txCustomCTCSS: false customCTCSS: 0.0 squelchMode: Carrier scrambler: false

section.para: This section describes the common channel attributes. Theses attributes are shared between FM and DMR channels.

listitem.para: If true, talkaround is enabled for this channel. This will bypass the repeater on repeater channels and allows to talk to other participants directly.
Specifies some sort of correction to the frequency in some unknown units. Consider contacting me, if you know more details about it.

If true, the hands-free feature is enabled for this channel. The actual configuration of the hands-free feature happens in the general settings extension. This setting is only applicable to the AT-D578UV device.

section.para: These attributes are only valid for FM channels.

listitem.para: If true, a CTCSS phase-reverse burst is send at the end of transmission. This phase reversal of the CTCSS tone at the end of the transmission can be used to prevent a noise tail at the end of the transmission on the receiver side. See Reverse CTCSS for details.
If true, the custom CTCSS frequency (see customCTCSS) is used to control the squelch.
If true, the custom CTCSS frequency (see customCTCSS) is transmitted.
Specifies a custom CTCSS frequency in Hz. The frequency can be specified with a resolution of 0.1Hz.
Specifies the squelch mode. Must be one of Carrier, SubTone, OptSig, SubToneAndOptSig or SubToneOrOptSig.
If true, the analog scrambler is enabled. It is not legal to use scramblers in HAM radio.

section.para: This section describes the attributes, applicable to DMR channels on AnyTone devices.

listitem.para: If true, the call confirmation is enabled.
If true, the SMS reception is enabled.
If true, the SMS confirmation is enabled.
If true, the transmission of data acknowledgement is enabled.
If true, TDMA mode for simplex channels is enabled. This mode is also known as DCDM (dual-capacity direct mode, see DCDM)

If true, the adaptive TDMA mode is enabled. This makes only sense, if simplexTDMA is enabled too. In this case, the radio is able to receive both simplex TDMA as well as normal simplex DMR on the channel.
If true, the lone-worker feature (see Lone Worker) is enabled for this channel. Usually not used in HAM radio.
If true, the through mode is enabled. What ever that means. If you know more about it, consider extending this section.
